alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 10:30AM MDT until June 20 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Excessive rainfall Wednesday evening resulted in minor flooding along Little Goose Creek and minor street flooding in and around the cities of Sheridan and Big Horn. Water levels may be slow to recede due to additional rainfall over and near the Big Horns this morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 AM MDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Some county roads are partially flooded. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan and Big Horn. - Low lying areas adjacent to Little Goose Creek will also see minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
